answer_to_complaint.description: Answer must be served within 20 days after service of process (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.140)
exceptions: Extended to 60 days for U.S. Marshal service
Extended when service is by publication

motion_to_dismiss.description: Motion to Dismiss must be filed within 20 days after service of process, before filing answer
exceptions: May be filed with answer if no prior opportunity
Extension may be granted by court

interrogatories.description: Response to interrogatories must be served within 30 days (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.340)

requests_for_admission.description: Response to requests for admission must be served within 30 days (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.370)

deposition_notice.description: Notice of deposition must be served at least 10 days before deposition (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.310)

motion_filing.description: Notice of hearing on motion must be served at least 5 days before hearing (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.090)
exceptions: Extended by 3 days if served by mail
Extended by 2 days if served electronically

appeal_deadline.description: Notice of Appeal must be filed within 30 days of rendition of order or judgment (Fla. R. App. P. § 9.110)

notice_period.description: Ex parte motions require reasonable notice unless immediate irreparable harm is shown

filing_time.description: Ex parte motions typically heard at morning calendar

requirements: Verified complaint or affidavit showing specific facts
Certificate of good faith effort to notify or explanation why notice should not be required
Affidavit showing diligent search and inquiry
Service on person 15 years or older at dwelling
Mailing copy to defendant's last known address

service_by_mail.description: Service by mail extends response time by 5 days (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.080)

electronic_service.description: Electronic service extends response time by 2 days (Fla. R. Civ. P. § 1.080)

court_fees.fee_waiver_form: Application for Determination of Civil Indigent Status
